commit_message:
Fix an issue on release_address

On ipam_release_address, kuryr unset all the neutron ports with
the released IP address. This is incorrect because IP address
is not unique across an OpenStack deployment.

This patch adds a check for verifying the subnet of a port
before reseting the port. If the port's subnet doesn't
match the subnet of the pool, the port is not the target and
won't be reset.

In order to identify the subnet given a pool ID. This patch
tags each kuryr created subnet with the pool ID.

Change-Id: I8f85ae53c924aa1f4ff877f52a56d267f984dbf5
Closes-Bug: #1782947
Related-Bug: #1782942

subject: Add the ability to run a post devstack hook
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12033, 'name': 'DellEMC XtremIO CI', 'email': 'emc.xio.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-xio-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26507, 'name': 'Michel Peterson', 'email': 'michel@redhat.com', 'username': 'mpeterson'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-01 10:26:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-01 10:30:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Another option to address the issue of preparations -if the intention is to leave devstack on the run phase- could be to divide the devstack-tempest playbook into a playbook for only `hosts: all` and another for `hosts: tempest` and create a master playbook that imports them with the `import_playbook` directive. This way if a job needs to run preparations it could create a run playbook that imports first the `hosts: all` part, run tasks intended for preparation and then import the `hosts: tempest` part.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-01 10:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-01-01 11:31:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I see where you're coming from, and I definitely agree there should be a mechanism to run something between devstack and tempest. Most of the stuff will be in devstack plugins but still a devstack post_hook that invokes a role to be defined is probably a good idea.

When pre fails it is retried three times by zuul. This means that the content of the change should not have a chance to impact what's in pre, so zuul retries what is likely to be an temp issue in a cloud.

However devstack installs and configures tempest, and it even runs verify-tempest-config, so there is a decent for a tempest change to fail on devstack. Working on Tempest core bits I've seen it a lot in fact. Because of that I'm -1 on this.

But as I said, I'm happy to work to find a different solution to your second issue (post devstack hook)."}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-01 14:27:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For reference, discussion on IRC about this:


14:30:00 < andreaf> mpeterson: well my experience with ansible is not so extensive but I think it should be possible to include a role dynamically                          
14:30:00 < andreaf> mpeterson: so if we had the role name defined in a variable in the job we could invoke that role between devstack and tempest if it exists              
14:32:00 < andreaf> mpeterson: of course there may be the case where such a role with the same name is defined in multiple places, but if we namespace the role name it     
                    should be ok           
14:33:00 < andreaf> mpeterson: I don't know what / if jeblair / mordred had in mind from a design pov to handle these kind of situations                                    
14:34:00 < mpeterson> andreaf: good, I had the same idea, I'm just not sure there is a way to detect if that role exists before including it, although we could not even    
                      check for existence and try to include/import it and fail if it doesn't exist                                                                         
14:34:00 < andreaf> mpeterson: of course an easy alternative would be for you to override the run play, use the roles and put what you need in the middle                   
14:34:00 < andreaf> mpeterson: 99% of the logic shall stay in roles anyways so you shouldn't be missing much by overriding the play                                         
14:35:00 < mpeterson> andreaf: of course, that's an alternative. But then we lose the beauty of inheritance that zuul3 provides                                             
14:36:00 < andreaf> mpeterson: well, you're still inheriting all the roles            
14:36:00 < andreaf> mpeterson: which is most of it                                    
14:36:00 < andreaf> mpeterson: and still inheriting post and pre as well              
14:37:00 < mpeterson> andreaf: true that. Just things could change in the future in the way run is executed and then we lose the "free" maintainability                     
14:38:00 < andreaf> mpeterson: yeah... I guess we'll need to come up with some kind of stable interface and deprecation process for roles to avoid that                     
14:38:00 < andreaf> mpeterson: but it's a bit early for that I think - if we did that now we would be making the ramp-up process to slow                                    
14:41:00 < mpeterson> andreaf: understandable. I guess the question remains, whether we would want to have a hook for now or favor the overriding of the run play.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-03 14:14:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-10 10:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-15 12:18:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-15 12:50:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-15 13:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-01-15 14:08:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

I think this is a good idea, but I'd prefer to see the post-hook implemented in the run-devstack role. We can add there the name of extra role(s) to be included. If we make it a list, and iterate over it, we will include no role when the list is zero length."}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:48:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> I think this is a good idea, but I'd prefer to see the post-hook
 > implemented in the run-devstack role. We can add there the name of
 > extra role(s) to be included. If we make it a list, and iterate
 > over it, we will include no role when the list is zero length.

As we discussed on the chat, run-devstack is something you would usually run in a pre-run play and therefore composition to add multiple steps could still be an option.

In the case of tempest there is a particular reason for not to do it in a pre-run play and therefore tempest is the exception. As such, this is the better place to address the issue."}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-23 14:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-28 15:14:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

recheck - logs deleted'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-28 17:28:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-29 08:52:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-29 16:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck -- zuul was unstable'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-02-06 08:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-02-09 18:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-02-09 22:46:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Published edit on patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-02-09 23:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Published edit on patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-02-09 23:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-02-09 23:25:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

@Michel - sorry I took over your patch, I'm experimenting what works with the version of ansible we're running, I think this last patch-set should be fine.
I put a patch on top for testing purposes as well. Feel free to take back control at any time."}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-02-10 05:34:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Published edit on patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-02-11 22:31:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)

Unfortunately, I didn't find a way around https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/33386.
If the variable is defined in the play the dynamic import role works else not.
And the value of the variable which contains the role name is calculated before variables from facts or inventory are evaluated. The fix exists in the latest ansible but it has not not been backported.

Having a fixed role name does not sound like a good option because it may lead to name conflicts. We could include a task or play list (http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/include_module.html) but we have then we need a way for tempest play to resolve the play file name to where the yaml file actually is."}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-02-11 23:16:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

I guess we could wait for zuul 2.4 to merge https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:zuul-ansible-2.4+(status:open+OR+status:merged)'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-02-19 21:12:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

We wrote Zuul v3 so we could get rid of hooks.  I don't think we should add them back.

Instead, how about we make a 'run-tempest' role, then it's really easy for jobs to put "run-devstack" and "run-tempest" in whichever playbooks are appropriate for those jobs.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-02-23 15:22:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

> We wrote Zuul v3 so we could get rid of hooks.  I don't think we
 > should add them back.
 > 
 > Instead, how about we make a 'run-tempest' role, then it's really
 > easy for jobs to put "run-devstack" and "run-tempest" in whichever
 > playbooks are appropriate for those jobs.

While I understand the concern and I'm not sure what a better solution would be to address it, I want to chime in that the solution you propose misses the point of relying in the parent's run playbook. In this case, the result is that the run playbook needs to be copied from tempest to add the required steps to it -while having to sync up any change that tempest introduces in the future.

As I hope I was able to explain, this situation is also not ideal either.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-07-23 12:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-01 10:26:09.000000000', 'message': 'Run devstack in the pre-run instead of run

Devstack is being run on the `run` phase of the job. This phase is
usually meant for the part that is intended to succeed or fail based on
the content of the change. For the case of tempest, that should be the
tempest run in and of itself.In addition, devstack being run in the run
phase rules out the opportunity for a devstack-tempest job to do other
after devstack is running but before running tempest.

This changes creates a pre-run phase to run devstack and its run is
removed from the run phase. This change tackles both issues
aforementioned.

Change-Id: I20a078ed4063bcf8719debf98c7df85d193041c4
'}, {'created': '2018-01-01 10:30:28.000000000', 'message': 'Run devstack in the pre-run instead of run

Devstack is being run on the `run` phase of the job. This phase is
usually meant for the part that is intended to succeed or fail based on
the content of the change. For the case of tempest, that should be the
tempest run in and of itself. In addition, devstack being run in the run
phase rules out the opportunity for a devstack-tempest job to do other
after devstack is running but before running tempest.

This changes creates a pre-run phase to run devstack and its run is
removed from the run phase. This change tackles both issues
aforementioned.

Change-Id: I20a078ed4063bcf8719debf98c7df85d193041c4
'}, {'created': '2018-01-03 14:14:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add the ability to run a post devstack hook

Devstack is being run on the `run` phase of the job. This phase is
usually meant for the part that is intended to succeed or fail based on
the content of the change. For the case of tempest, that should be the
tempest run in and of itself. However, since any change that run through
devstack-tempest are likely to have an impact on the devstack part of
the job, the devstack run is also part of the `run` phase. In addition,
devstack being run in the run phase rules out the opportunity for a
devstack-tempest job to do other tasks after devstack is running but
before running tempest.

This changes creates a new role that is meant to run a hook just after
devstack finishes its preparation. To do so it introduces the variable
`tempest_post_devstack` that when defined runs the role that it targets.

Change-Id: I20a078ed4063bcf8719debf98c7df85d193041c4

usually meant for the part that is intended to succeed or fail based on
the content of the change. For the case of tempest, that should be the
tempest run in and of itself. However, since any change that run through
devstack-tempest are likely to have an impact on the devstack part of
the job, the devstack run is also part of the `run` phase. In addition,
devstack being run in the run phase rules out the opportunity for a
devstack-tempest job to do other tasks after devstack is running but
before running tempest.

This changes creates a new role that is meant to run a hook just after
devstack finishes its preparation. To do so it introduces the variable
`tempest_post_devstack` that when defined runs the role that it targets.

commit_message:
Add the ability to run a post devstack hook

Devstack is being run on the `run` phase of the job. This phase is
usually meant for the part that is intended to succeed or fail based on
the content of the change. For the case of tempest, that should be the
tempest run in and of itself. However, since any change that run through
devstack-tempest are likely to have an impact on the devstack part of
the job, the devstack run is also part of the `run` phase. In addition,
devstack being run in the run phase rules out the opportunity for a
devstack-tempest job to do other tasks after devstack is running but
before running tempest.

This changes creates a new role that is meant to run a hook just after
devstack finishes its preparation. To do so it introduces the variable
`tempest_post_devstack` that when defined runs the role that it targets.

Change-Id: I20a078ed4063bcf8719debf98c7df85d193041c4

commit_message:
WIP: run repo-setup in pre (and then being able to deploy pkgs in pre)

To save time in run playbooks, we want to see if we can deploy the repos
before in pre phase, and maybe pre-download some rpms that aren't in the
image, so we save time in run phase.

Change-Id: I4c2fee3cc6e86d2918558feb62980f9e2d6bc4aa

commit_message:
Install openstack-selinux in pre-phase

It takes 4 minutes to be deployed with the re-labelling actions, so it's
good to save this time from run phase.

Change-Id: I1c86ce709a29305a2191fb4b6775c7947a13e002

commit_message:
Replace use of os.errno.* with errno.*

According to the following, os.errno has been removed in Py3.7:
https://bugs.python.org/msg317876

Change-Id: I941ba24a5f4ede4cc596dca92946ff5ae88a1d53
Closes-Bug: #1782204

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 16:07:58.000000000', 'message': 'Replace StopIteration with return for PEP 0479

PEP 0479, https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0479/, makes the
following change: "when StopIteration is raised inside a generator,
it is replaced it with RuntimeError".

The PEP suggests that if raise StopIteration occurs directly in a
generator, simply replace it with return.

Change-Id: I9bb72936c8d56b338084bb0be7e75aecdf09f8b3
Closes-Bug: #1780827
'}]
commit_message:
Replace StopIteration with return for PEP 0479

PEP 0479, https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0479/, makes the
following change: "when StopIteration is raised inside a generator,
it is replaced it with RuntimeError".

The PEP suggests that if raise StopIteration occurs directly in a
generator, simply replace it with return.

Change-Id: I9bb72936c8d56b338084bb0be7e75aecdf09f8b3
Closes-Bug: #1780827

This update try to fix some problems:
1. define the 'id' both in _data_fields and _auto_generated_attrs.
2. some of tables don't have the 'id' field.
3. _data_fields of DBInstance miss some table fields.
4. Change the key of persisted_models as the same of table name to

commit_message:
Sync the data fields of DB* class and table fields.

This update try to fix some problems:
1. define the 'id' both in _data_fields and _auto_generated_attrs.
2. some of tables don't have the 'id' field.
3. _data_fields of DBInstance miss some table fields.
4. Change the key of persisted_models as the same of table name to
make it more readable.

Change-Id: I0ad96824e8de978ff5b6766085549b1e1a2509cf
Signed-off-by: zhanggang <zhanggang@cmss.chinamobile.com>

commit_message:
iLO BIOS interface implementation

Adds support for manual cleaning steps "apply_configuration" and
"factory_reset" which manage BIOS settings on the iLO. This requires to
implement 'ilo' BIOS interface for 'ilo' hardware type.

Story: #2002899
Task: #22863
Change-Id: Ia014ea3d55504e8e0c815fb4f19bb87b1fc0d6ef

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 17:46:03.000000000', 'message': "WIP Configure keepalived before rabbitmq

Sometimes an undercloud could fail to install with the following error:
2018-05-29 12:53:17,588 INFO: May 29 12:53:08 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting RabbitMQ broker...
2018-05-29 12:53:17,588 INFO: May 29 12:53:11 foo.int.bar rabbitmq-server[14327]: ERROR: epmd error for host foo: address (cannot connect to host/port)
2018-05-29 12:53:17,588 INFO: May 29 12:53:11 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: rabbitmq-server.service: main process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILURE

1) The hostname of the box is
foo.int.bar foo

and in the hosts file we have the following entry: 192.168.248.2
192.168.248.2 foo.int.bar foo

Note: 192.168.248.2 is a VIP managed by keepalived because we configured this
undercloud to be an SSL one so we have:
undercloud_public_host = 192.168.248.2

2) At this stage we see rabbitmq-server being started:
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting Flexible Branding Service...
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: epmd@0.0.0.0.socket failed to listen on sockets: Address already in use
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Failed to listen on Erlang Port Mapper Daemon Activation Socket.
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Unit epmd@0.0.0.0.socket entered failed state.
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting Erlang Port Mapper Daemon Activation Socket.
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting RabbitMQ broker...
Jan 27 06:46:34 foo.int.bar rabbitmq-server[14532]: ERROR: epmd error for host foo: address (cannot connect to host/port)

Now epmd might have already been up (and normally the failed message is
not particularly concerning). But the real problem is that we are trying
to connect to foo which maps to a VIP, but the VIP gets started only
later by keepalived:
3)
Jan 27 07:02:30 foo.int.bar Keepalived_vrrp[914]: VRRP_Instance(42) Sending/queueing gratuitous ARPs on br-ctlplane for 192.168.248.2
Jan 27 07:02:30 foo.int.bar Keepalived_vrrp[914]: Sending gratuitous ARP on br-ctlplane for 192.168.248.2

Let's make sure keepalived is up and running before rabbitmq in order to
fix this.

Change-Id: I010102b01e41610838c836a743a07be1965944d6
Closes-Bug: #1782814

commit_message:
Configure keepalived before rabbitmq

Sometimes an undercloud could fail to install with the following error:
2018-05-29 12:53:17,588 INFO: May 29 12:53:08 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting RabbitMQ broker...
2018-05-29 12:53:17,588 INFO: May 29 12:53:11 foo.int.bar rabbitmq-server[14327]: ERROR: epmd error for host foo: address (cannot connect to host/port)
2018-05-29 12:53:17,588 INFO: May 29 12:53:11 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: rabbitmq-server.service: main process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILURE

1) The hostname of the box is
foo.int.bar foo

and in the hosts file we have the following entry: 192.168.248.2
192.168.248.2 foo.int.bar foo

Note: 192.168.248.2 is a VIP managed by keepalived because we configured this
undercloud to be an SSL one so we have:
undercloud_public_host = 192.168.248.2

2) At this stage we see rabbitmq-server being started:
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting Flexible Branding Service...
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: epmd@0.0.0.0.socket failed to listen on sockets: Address already in use
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Failed to listen on Erlang Port Mapper Daemon Activation Socket.
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Unit epmd@0.0.0.0.socket entered failed state.
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting Erlang Port Mapper Daemon Activation Socket.
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting RabbitMQ broker...
Jan 27 06:46:34 foo.int.bar rabbitmq-server[14532]: ERROR: epmd error for host foo: address (cannot connect to host/port)

Now epmd might have already been up (and normally the failed message is
not particularly concerning). But the real problem is that we are trying
to connect to foo which maps to a VIP, but the VIP gets started only
later by keepalived:
3)
Jan 27 07:02:30 foo.int.bar Keepalived_vrrp[914]: VRRP_Instance(42) Sending/queueing gratuitous ARPs on br-ctlplane for 192.168.248.2
Jan 27 07:02:30 foo.int.bar Keepalived_vrrp[914]: Sending gratuitous ARP on br-ctlplane for 192.168.248.2

Let's make sure keepalived is up and running before rabbitmq in order to
fix this.

Change-Id: I010102b01e41610838c836a743a07be1965944d6
Closes-Bug: #1782814

[{'created': '2018-07-23 04:54:23.000000000', 'message': 'Decode content from docker.get_archive

It looks the data returned by docker.get_arhive cannot be decoded
when sending via RPC. This patch decodes the content on reading
the docker response.

commit_message:
Decode content from docker.get_archive

It looks the data returned by docker.get_arhive cannot be decoded
when sending via RPC. This patch decodes the content on reading
the docker response.

Change-Id: I579910ce5b8e5cd7945d6473db6daa7b3a039f88
Cloes-Bug: #1783051

commit_message:
Migrate to Zuul v3 native job definitions

This patch migrates the legacy gate jobs to Zuul v3 native ones(a new
trove-devstack role is created for all those legecy jobs, and the
previous way of running gate jobs is still kept as we still cannot
migrate the genade job to a Zuul v3 native one), following the
documents below:
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html
https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/zuul_ci_jobs_migration.html

Change-Id: I10a1adae3a79b7322118fce180119f0ee5ff2e1b
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Empty option value maybe cause Unity driver failed to initialize

If the value of list type option is empty, Unity driver may failed to
initialize.

Example:
unity_io_ports=
unity_storage_pool_names=

Change-Id: Ib5850d984bfd3651d308f448993251e9ec5a9460
Closes-bug: #1775518
(cherry picked from commit 2ecfd6144ba79334740407241c8fa5d7ad928840)
(cherry picked from commit c7f9d29e17523653b7d2f0eb2b109798235b6ebb)

commit_message:
Install mistral-lib as a sibling for tox jobs

If mistral-lib is not processed as a required-project, it won't get
treated properly as a depends-on. This should fix that.

Change-Id: I1f42836ec549a3e56681af29738868bf5896e971

'}, {'created': '2018-06-14 14:39:48.000000000', 'message': "Add grenade plugin

This patch is configuring a grenade job which exercises upgrading the
networking-ovn ML2 driver. Note that a previous grenade job already
existed in the experiemental pipeline but was outdated and broken; the
previous job was also experimenting migrating from ML2/OVS to ML2/OVN
but we don't want that anymore since that scenario is now handlded by
ansible and the files can be found at networking-ovn/migration.

A TODO was left about upgrading OVN itself as part of the upgrade

commit_message:
Add grenade plugin

This patch is configuring a grenade job which exercises upgrading the
networking-ovn ML2 driver. Note that a previous grenade job already
existed in the experiemental pipeline but was outdated and broken; the
previous job was also experimenting migrating from ML2/OVS to ML2/OVN
but we don't want that anymore since that scenario is now handlded by
ansible and the files can be found at networking-ovn/migration.

A TODO was left about upgrading OVN itself as part of the upgrade
process, this can be added in a follow up patch and will require some
more investigation.

We are also starting as a non-voting job until we are confident enough
to enable it in the gate pipeline.

Change-Id: I3b1593710b42918870d4f0b183ba3616f0ae027f

commit_message:
Remove attached_mac attribute from the switch port

This field is not used anywhere and is redundant.
Instead the mac_in_use should be used.

Change-Id: I50d2fdbe188da1fff77021776620a47b8f05ebeb
Partial-Bug: #1781376

commit_message:
Refactor DVR HA migarations DB operations

when a router is migrated from/to HA, router interface device_owner
in DB is updated in the AFTER_UPDATE event handler. Because of this
we see StaleDataError Trace as described in the bug report.
Instead, we follow DVR approach and update it in PRECOMMIT_UPDATE
handler, which only does DB changes. Here we update device_owner only
between legacy and HA router modes as migration involving DVR is
already handled in DVR code.

Also update distributed flag after all DB operations. Otherwise existing
code may affect router unbinding during retry as distributed flag
already updated before retry.

Testing is covered with scenario tempest test i.e
DVR HA migrations tests from gate job
"legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr-multinode-scenario".

Closes-Bug: 1715163
Change-Id: I6e5783c44c77ec07371921e900ed45efd031ebdb

commit_message:
Allow deploying ocata/pike nova on current k-a

nova-compute will not start because of a placement configuration error
if it is Pike or older, because it needs the old version of the
region_name option.

Change-Id: Ieac8921673b9034f198026f281e3c2347c7c0159

commit_message:
Move scenario-lxd over to experimental

scenario-lxd has been consistently failing at gate. Let's move it over
to experimental. To trigger the job, comment "check experimental" in a
Gerrit review.

Change-Id: Ic64801c74c28e2ca77a11c893329e933f5c35309
(cherry picked from commit c71298aeb4ddcb916fd6a441cb72ab3cbd2d7975)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 13:17:33.000000000', 'message': "Collect /tmp/ansible-mistral-action into CI job logs.

When executing the ansible-playbook mistral
action a directory is created within undercloud's
/tmp/. This directory contains the ansible
configuration files used to run the playbook, as well
as an script which contains the ansible-playbook
command run. All this information can be very
useful for CI job debugging purposes now that
we're moving into an ansible-centric TripleO
operations.

Change-Id: Iead9d9cd8ba50239ebd5cd26389de89c8a7ba646
"}]
commit_message:
Collect /tmp/ansible-mistral-action into CI job logs.

When executing the ansible-playbook mistral
action a directory is created within undercloud's
/tmp/. This directory contains the ansible
configuration files used to run the playbook, as well
as an script which contains the ansible-playbook
command run. All this information can be very
useful for CI job debugging purposes now that
we're moving into an ansible-centric TripleO
operations.

Change-Id: Iead9d9cd8ba50239ebd5cd26389de89c8a7ba646

commit_message:
Use tempest user with tempest container

* https://review.openstack.org/583940 adds tempest user to tempest
  container, it also  saves us from changing permission of any folder
* It removes the tasks for setting permission.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/583940

Change-Id: I3c8ef06d9c776b00cbf728b23f6644c38e4e3301

Hi Vlad, is there any drawback security wise to setting these values? Is this recommended in the case of NFS? Sorry it's not clear to me from trawling the links."}, {'account_id': 13671, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:48:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

yes, there are drawbacks when using old nfs security. 

Difference is described here:
https://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/block-storage/checklist.html#check-block-07-is-nas-operating-in-a-secure-environment

Ideally we should not disable the feature, but the current implementation makes it unusable. Without secure nas flags volumes are owned by root and rw by everyone on nfs server and inside cinder_volume container. Other containers don't see the volumes so they cannot access them even given such generous permissions."}, {'account_id': 13671, 'date': '2018-01-29 11:52:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-01-30 06:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-03-12 12:38:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> yes, there are drawbacks when using old nfs security.
 > 
 > Difference is described here:
 > https://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/block-storage/checklist.html#check-block-07-is-nas-operating-in-a-secure-environment
 > 
 > Ideally we should not disable the feature, but the current
 > implementation makes it unusable. Without secure nas flags volumes
 > are owned by root and rw by everyone on nfs server and inside
 > cinder_volume container. Other containers don't see the volumes so
 > they cannot access them even given such generous permissions.

This sounds like a Cinder bug then rather than anything to do with Kolla's implementation? Am I reading this right?"}, {'account_id': 13671, 'date': '2018-05-23 11:16:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 13671, 'date': '2018-05-23 11:18:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

we have to choose between enabling snapshots or secure nas feature. If using both cinder reports errors:

/var/lib/docker/volumes/kolla_logs/_data/cinder/cinder-volume.log:2018-05-23 11:32:27.632 37 ERROR cinder.volume.drivers.nfs [req-4dd2d20c-7673-40d8-880f-c1c1578790b9 - - - - -] Snapshots are not supported with nas_secure_file_operations enabled ('true' or 'auto'). Please set it to 'false' if you intend to  have it enabled."}, {'account_id': 13671, 'date': '2018-05-23 11:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9820, 'date': '2018-05-25 11:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-06-11 16:21:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-07-23 08:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-24 12:46:52.000000000', 'message': "Cinder fails some operations with secure NAS features

Secure NAS features don't work well with qemu owned volumes.
E.g. if an instance is created via Horizon it is made into
a new volume with qemu permissions unlike normal Cinder volumes.
Cinder cannot make snapshots or backups of such volumes because
it runs as cinder user and tries to issue chown on the volume
files according to the enabled features.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1433404
https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2017:2654

Change-Id: Iba3783b2acb79dd0e765862ef972a568c96ec108
Closes-Bug: #1726836
"}, {'created': '2018-01-29 11:52:44.000000000', 'message': "Cinder fails some operations with secure NAS features

Change-Id: Iba3783b2acb79dd0e765862ef972a568c96ec108
Closes-Bug: #1726836
"}, {'created': '2018-05-23 11:20:57.000000000', 'message': 'Cinder fails to run because snapshots are not compatible with secure NAS

Cinder cannot run with both snapshots or backups of volumes and
secure NAS feature. Choosing the former as the latter does not function
well everywhere.

Change-Id: Iba3783b2acb79dd0e765862ef972a568c96ec108
Closes-Bug: #1726836
'}]
commit_message:
Cinder fails to run because snapshots are not compatible with secure NAS

Cinder cannot run with both snapshots or backups of volumes and
secure NAS feature. Choosing the former as the latter does not function
well everywhere.

Change-Id: Iba3783b2acb79dd0e765862ef972a568c96ec108
Closes-Bug: #1726836

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 21:03:03.000000000', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- cinder_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- cinder_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I54bf526e917febbc873f6a4b48ad00c17a372523
"}, {'created': '2018-07-19 18:15:05.000000000', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

- cinder_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I54bf526e917febbc873f6a4b48ad00c17a372523
"}]
commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- cinder_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- cinder_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I54bf526e917febbc873f6a4b48ad00c17a372523

commit_message:
New horizon_enable_router variable

Set to False if you don't want router support in Horizon or if you don't
have Neutron L3 agent deployed.

Change-Id: I72eaa7829372b91c286efa06263e3f78b86ef35c

commit_message:
Support setting rp_filter mode

Enables setting rp_filter mode on Neutron L3 agent and Nova compute
hosts whilst maintaining the default that it is disabled.

Closes-Bug: #1782799
Change-Id: I93e53bad9727beb786b00bd7fcd6d78785c619c2

commit_message:
Increase the step for gnocchi_db_sync

swift-proxy and gnocchi both run on step_4. However, swift_proxy should
be ready before gnocchi. This patch moves gnocchi_db_sync to step_5 to
be sure that swift-proxy is started before gnocchi. gnocchi_db_sync has
higher start_order to start before other gnocchi services.

Change-Id: I0044c78c4a6d751fc9d0cf6b54ed634032933934
Closes-Bug: 1781162

> Looks sensible, is there a bug report we can reference?

Hi, after my verification, this problem has nothing to do with the variable use_preconfigured_databases. Take keystone as an example. For example, I only install keystone, although dababase is not registered, it has content.
```
"database": {
        "changed": false, 
        "skip_reason": "Conditional result was False", 
        "skipped": true
    }
```
But if I install ceph with "--tags", if keystone is also enabled, then an error will be reported. Please refer to the bug description.'}, {'account_id': 24250, 'date': '2018-07-12 05:37:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-07-12 06:17:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

i still can not understand the issue.

when using '--tags ceph', why keystone role still run?"}, {'account_id': 24250, 'date': '2018-07-12 07:13:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> i still can not understand the issue.
 > 
 > when using '--tags ceph', why keystone role still run?

Hi, I tested the repaired code. It seems that the process is ansible first loads the play file contained in the keystone's deploy.yml, then skip them. 
It checks the condition when loading this task, but does not perform the corresponding task.
I updated the latest log in the bug description, please refer to it.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1781317/comments/1"}, {'account_id': 24250, 'date': '2018-07-13 06:18:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> i still can not understand the issue.
 > 
 > when using '--tags ceph', why keystone role still run?

Hi Jeffrey, I found the following description in the ansible document:
The above information does not apply to include_tasks or other dynamic includes, as the attributes applied to an include, only affect the include itself.
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_tags.html

So the conclusion is that "--tags" will still call the include tasks of other roles, but will not perform these tasks.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-07-13 07:35:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think the tags here are coincidental - you would hit the same error running without tags. Interesting point about include though.'}, {'account_id': 24250, 'date': '2018-07-13 08:01:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> I think the tags here are coincidental - you would hit the same
 > error running without tags. Interesting point about include though.

 > I think the tags here are coincidental - you would hit the same
 > error running without tags. Interesting point about include though.

Hi Mark Goddard, I tested three cases. 
The first one is not using "-- tags", but I disabled keystone. In this case, ansible will skip any keystone tasks.
The second is to enable keystone, then set use_preconfigured_databases to "true" and then deploy keystone. In this case, although the task of registering the database is not executed, the database variable still has a value, like this:
"database": {
        "changed": false, 
        "skip_reason": "Conditional result was False", 
        "skipped": true
    }

The last one is to enable keystone, but use "--tags" to deploy ceph, this problem will occur.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-07-13 18:32:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I see, thanks for explaining.

I would prefer the simpler logic I suggested, but happy to take this as it fixes the issue.'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2018-07-14 02:18:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Thanks for your review, in the third case mentioned above, I tested your logic. But when 'use_preconfigured_databases' is false, the logical database.changed still needs to be evaluated, in this case, the 'database' is still undefined, so the same error will occur.'}, {'account_id': 24250, 'date': '2018-07-14 02:48:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yes, I also use the latest version of ansible 2.6.1, but I read the latest documentation for ansible. In the case of "--tags", the include task with other tags will still be called. So I don't know whether the next version will change this feature.

I see. I thought this issue only happened with use_preconfigured_databases=true, but it seems it will always happen when specifying tags.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-07-17 16:04:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 09:01:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed undefined error about database variable

When "use_preconfigured_databases" is "false", the variable "database"
will be registered, but when the "use_preconfigured_databases" is "true",
the "database" is not defined. At this time, the deployment will report
an error, such as "'database' is undefined".

Change-Id: Idb6d0daaddc988ef7653fb68a04dd67ffa9f8fe1
'}, {'created': '2018-07-11 09:02:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed undefined error about database variable

When "use_preconfigured_databases" is "false", the variable "database"
will be registered, but when the "use_preconfigured_databases" is
"true", the "database" is not defined. At this time, the deployment
will report an error, such as "'database' is undefined".

Change-Id: Idb6d0daaddc988ef7653fb68a04dd67ffa9f8fe1
'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 05:22:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed undefined error about database variable

When using "--tags" to deploy a specific role, such as ceph, the files
in the deploy.yml of other enabled roles will also be loaded, although
it will not be executed, but it seems that some judgment conditions
will be checked. But at this time the database variable is undefined,
so it will cause the deployment error "'database' is undefined".

This commit fixes this problem.

Closes-bug: #1781317

Change-Id: Idb6d0daaddc988ef7653fb68a04dd67ffa9f8fe1
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed undefined error about database variable

When using "--tags" to deploy a specific role, such as ceph, the files
in the deploy.yml of other enabled roles will also be loaded, although
it will not be executed, but it seems that some judgment conditions
will be checked. But at this time the database variable is undefined,
so it will cause the deployment error "'database' is undefined".

This commit fixes this problem.

Closes-bug: #1781317

Change-Id: Idb6d0daaddc988ef7653fb68a04dd67ffa9f8fe1

commit_message:
Remove the redundant "required=True"

The django form field default is "required=True", so this patch
remove the redundant "required=True" in the form.

Change-Id: I3d91ae0638b69d56c1f1b72913ee4995db249007

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1], stestr is maintained project
to which all Openstack projects should migrate. Let's switch to stestr
as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I02e33d429154936db9ca65b4fd04cfa10754507b

commit_message:
Support alias for job creation

This commit to support alias for job creation, to create job
use function_alias pramater, and get function_id and function_version
from function_alias. Also add function tests for job creation.

Change-Id: If3df940b9bc8453036f8615173136ba05e8769d6
Story: #2002143
Task: #19984

commit_message:
Avoid recovery from failure twice

This patch checks if the notification status is New and the one
from DB is not New in order to decide whether to run recovery
from failure or not.

Change-Id: I7975d1a464e8b0644b4964da4976b1a9eecc29a9
Closes-Bug: #1773132

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 09:42:11.000000000', 'message': 'Disable TLS 1.1 on haproxy

While it is possible to implement countermeasures against some attacks
on TLS, migrating to a later version of TLS (TLS 1.2 is strongly
encouraged) is the only reliable method to protect against
the current protocol vulnerabilities.[1]

[1] https://blog.pcisecuritystandards.org/are-you-ready-for-30-june-2018-sayin-goodbye-to-ssl-early-tls

Change-Id: I44f67e3a49bb00fea069d29c46b3e86404c7df0b
'}, {'created': '2018-07-20 09:11:02.000000000', 'message': 'Disable TLS 1.1 on haproxy

While it is possible to implement countermeasures against some attacks
on TLS, migrating to a later version of TLS (TLS 1.2 is strongly
encouraged) is the only reliable method to protect against
the current protocol vulnerabilities.[1]

[1] https://blog.pcisecuritystandards.org/are-you-ready-for-30-june-2018-sayin-goodbye-to-ssl-early-tls

Change-Id: I44f67e3a49bb00fea069d29c46b3e86404c7df0b
'}]
commit_message:
Disable TLS 1.1 on haproxy

While it is possible to implement countermeasures against some attacks
on TLS, migrating to a later version of TLS (TLS 1.2 is strongly
encouraged) is the only reliable method to protect against
the current protocol vulnerabilities.[1]

[1] https://blog.pcisecuritystandards.org/are-you-ready-for-30-june-2018-sayin-goodbye-to-ssl-early-tls

Change-Id: I44f67e3a49bb00fea069d29c46b3e86404c7df0b

commit_message:
Remove unused code in ovn dbs bundle to set the sysctl value

The docker/services/pacemaker/ovn-dbs.yaml service file doesn't
define the puppet tag 'sysctl::value'. So this patch removes
the puppet code to set the sysctl - net.ipv4.ip_nonlocalbind' to 1.
Instead of adding this tag, the service file sets the above sysctl
value using the host_prep_tasks section in this patch - [1]

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582520/
Change-Id: I1076c88051cc48a263996024fcdfe8d917537d20
Related-bug: #1781585

subject: Enforce proper ordering when applying firewall rules
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-17 05:33:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-23 02:09:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 05:33:26.000000000', 'message': 'Enforce proper ordering when applying firewall rules

The tripleo firewall module has fundamentally three pieces:
1) firewall::pre (allows existing connections/ssh/icmp)
2) firewall::rule (allows services traffic)
3) firewall::post (drops all traffic)

One of the assumptions coded in the module is the following line:
Service<||> -> Class['tripleo::firewall::post']

Which has been added so that (see also bug LP#1643575):
"""
use ordering to make sure we start all Services in catalog before post
rules. It ensure that we don't drop all traffic before starting the
services, which could lead to services errors (e.g. trying to reach database or amqp)
"""

The problem is that there is nothing specifying that the firewall rules
created by tripleo services need to be implemented between the pre and
post classes. So the following can happen:
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 systemd: Started OpenSSH server daemon.
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Ssh::Server::Service/Service[sshd]) Triggered 'refresh' from 2 events
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Pre/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[000 accept related established rules]/Firewall[000 accept related established rules ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Post/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[998 log all]/Firewall[998 log all ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 10 05:04:14 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[cinder_api]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[119 cinder]/Firewall[119 cinder ipv4]/ensure) created

This means that we can actually open the traffic for our services *after*
said traffic has been completely blocked. In order to fix this we
tag the pre/post rules with a different tag and add resource collectors
to actually enforce proper ordering. We now get:
...
Jul 11 08:54:43 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Pre/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[000 accept related established rules]/Firewall[000 accept related established rules ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 11 08:54:43 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[cinder_api]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[119 cinder]/Firewall[119 cinder ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 11 08:54:52 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Post/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[998 log all]/Firewall[998 log all ipv4]/ensure) created

Tested this by doing 20 deploys of 1ctrl+1cmp and then scaling up the
overcloud to 3ctrl+2cmp.

The reason this change, besides being semantically correct, is needed
for scaling up the controller role is the following:
1) When we detect a scaleup situation, we call 'pcs cluster node add <newnode>'
   from the bootstrap node

2) It can happen that 1) succeeds because the node still had no iptables
   at all, so pcs communication succeeds. So at this point the cluster
   has added a new node and all is well

3) Now we apply the pre and post rules and all traffic is blocked. And
   slowly we start adding rules to let services be accessible over the
   network.

4) pacemaker is unable to talk to other nodes and assumes a network split.
   Eventually it will start fencing node to guarantee the state of the
   remote nodes and so the deploy will fail.

With this change if the 'pcs cluster node add' call succeeds we are
guaranteed to not interrupt network traffic afterwards.

NB: cherry-pick had a slight conflict due Ic9a2626e73d132c3be7ff14a1f4cdba0c16c5b53

Change-Id: I01e681a6305e2708bf364781a2032265b146d065
Closes-Bug: #1781147
(cherry picked from commit c525c64f6a9535b0b040cca1a7813e93dfaa797c)
(cherry picked from commit 9fdb07ec6653c751d79e66e7f0ab4a8ce68d120c)
'}]
commit_message:
Enforce proper ordering when applying firewall rules

The tripleo firewall module has fundamentally three pieces:
1) firewall::pre (allows existing connections/ssh/icmp)
2) firewall::rule (allows services traffic)
3) firewall::post (drops all traffic)

One of the assumptions coded in the module is the following line:
Service<||> -> Class['tripleo::firewall::post']

Which has been added so that (see also bug LP#1643575):
"""
use ordering to make sure we start all Services in catalog before post
rules. It ensure that we don't drop all traffic before starting the
services, which could lead to services errors (e.g. trying to reach database or amqp)
"""

The problem is that there is nothing specifying that the firewall rules
created by tripleo services need to be implemented between the pre and
post classes. So the following can happen:
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 systemd: Started OpenSSH server daemon.
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Ssh::Server::Service/Service[sshd]) Triggered 'refresh' from 2 events
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Pre/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[000 accept related established rules]/Firewall[000 accept related established rules ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Post/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[998 log all]/Firewall[998 log all ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 10 05:04:14 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[cinder_api]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[119 cinder]/Firewall[119 cinder ipv4]/ensure) created

This means that we can actually open the traffic for our services *after*
said traffic has been completely blocked. In order to fix this we
tag the pre/post rules with a different tag and add resource collectors
to actually enforce proper ordering. We now get:
...
Jul 11 08:54:43 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Pre/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[000 accept related established rules]/Firewall[000 accept related established rules ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 11 08:54:43 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[cinder_api]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[119 cinder]/Firewall[119 cinder ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 11 08:54:52 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Post/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[998 log all]/Firewall[998 log all ipv4]/ensure) created

Tested this by doing 20 deploys of 1ctrl+1cmp and then scaling up the
overcloud to 3ctrl+2cmp.

The reason this change, besides being semantically correct, is needed
for scaling up the controller role is the following:
1) When we detect a scaleup situation, we call 'pcs cluster node add <newnode>'
   from the bootstrap node

2) It can happen that 1) succeeds because the node still had no iptables
   at all, so pcs communication succeeds. So at this point the cluster
   has added a new node and all is well

3) Now we apply the pre and post rules and all traffic is blocked. And
   slowly we start adding rules to let services be accessible over the
   network.

4) pacemaker is unable to talk to other nodes and assumes a network split.
   Eventually it will start fencing node to guarantee the state of the
   remote nodes and so the deploy will fail.

With this change if the 'pcs cluster node add' call succeeds we are
guaranteed to not interrupt network traffic afterwards.

NB: cherry-pick had a slight conflict due Ic9a2626e73d132c3be7ff14a1f4cdba0c16c5b53

Change-Id: I01e681a6305e2708bf364781a2032265b146d065
Closes-Bug: #1781147
(cherry picked from commit c525c64f6a9535b0b040cca1a7813e93dfaa797c)
(cherry picked from commit 9fdb07ec6653c751d79e66e7f0ab4a8ce68d120c)

subject: Let haproxy_defaults be overridable
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-20 20:45:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-21 12:25:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-23 02:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 20:45:49.000000000', 'message': 'Let haproxy_defaults be overridable

Add the haproxy_defaults_override parameter so the defaults_options
in haproxy are overridable. Tested by adding the following yaml to
the deployment:
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    tripleo::haproxy::haproxy_defaults_override:
      retries: 7

Observed that haproxy.conf contained the following (retries defaults
to 3):
defaults
  retries  7

Change-Id: I52b8f528e334e4d243ac7f506b9f293dab9f478d
Closes-Bug: #1732176
(cherry picked from commit 37f0c004c5a80653d25a71a0292e26bad73ad3e1)
'}]
commit_message:
Let haproxy_defaults be overridable

Add the haproxy_defaults_override parameter so the defaults_options
in haproxy are overridable. Tested by adding the following yaml to
the deployment:
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    tripleo::haproxy::haproxy_defaults_override:
      retries: 7

Observed that haproxy.conf contained the following (retries defaults
to 3):
defaults
  retries  7

Change-Id: I52b8f528e334e4d243ac7f506b9f293dab9f478d
Closes-Bug: #1732176
(cherry picked from commit 37f0c004c5a80653d25a71a0292e26bad73ad3e1)

subject: Added new parameter: $activate_httplog
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-20 20:45:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-23 02:07:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 20:45:49.000000000', 'message': 'Added new parameter: $activate_httplog

This allows to get the full HTTP log (and TCP if not HTTP) from HAProxy,
in case you need any debug from that central point.

In case you want timers for those entries, you might want to use the
already present "$haproxy_globals_override" parameter and set its
content to:
{ 'log' => '/dev/log local0 debug'  }

Change-Id: I4667317cbd453875585521b22b0ccbdb208f5353
Closes-Bug: 1733801
(cherry picked from commit 323cd64c5829812545a7aa3afea5617566d6bbdf)
'}]
commit_message:
Added new parameter: $activate_httplog

This allows to get the full HTTP log (and TCP if not HTTP) from HAProxy,
in case you need any debug from that central point.

In case you want timers for those entries, you might want to use the
already present "$haproxy_globals_override" parameter and set its
content to:
{ 'log' => '/dev/log local0 debug'  }

Change-Id: I4667317cbd453875585521b22b0ccbdb208f5353
Closes-Bug: 1733801
(cherry picked from commit 323cd64c5829812545a7aa3afea5617566d6bbdf)

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/580017/6/ : SUCCESS in 2h 37m 11s'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-07-21 02:41:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Reiterating what I said in IRC:
 > 
 > (8:20:40 AM) mriedem: gmann: alex_xu: i see several of these
 > already merged https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/api-extensions-merge-rocky+(status:open+OR+status:merged)
 > but 2 things:
 > (8:20:57 AM) mriedem: 1. rather than cram it all into that single
 > create() method, it would be nice to instead continue the pattern
 > we have in here https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/helpers.py#L55
 > (8:21:17 AM) mriedem: 2. this series isn't moving the view builder
 > code from the extensions into the actual server ViewBuilder, which
 > is something we should do
 > (8:21:53 AM) mriedem: maybe the goal for rocky is to just remove
 > the server_create extension method and then in stein we
 > refactor/cleanup the create() controller method to move things into
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/helpers.py#L55
 > and also move stuff into the view builder?
 > (8:22:23 AM) mriedem: personally it's the view builder that bothers
 > me the most, because i have to hunt all over the extensions to find
 > what puts something into the server response body
 > (8:22:55 AM) mriedem: and the view builder part is going to become
 > very important for tssurya's change for handling a down cell
 > 
 > --
 > 
 > So if we want to just merge the rest of this series as-is and then
 > cleanup the create() controller method in Stein *and* cleanup the
 > view builder code, I can probably agree to that so we're at least
 > making incremental progress. I'd like to know if that's the plan
 > though.

>1st point
We can do that way also, but i am seeing that require to read another method about server create request arg alternation than just original create in server controller itself. But Yeah we can discuss and do in Stein. I will follow up on this in stein. 

>2nd
Yeah, that will be done as part-3 of this work. I am dividing this work into 3 part:
- part-1 - do schema merger. COMPLETED. 
- part-2 - server create merge - Patch all in gate and its +A now.
- part-3 - merging the view builder  - ongoing and i will completing the series by Monday. and yeah let's see if we can merged those in Rocky(i wish to). 

to avoid any regression as it is request, schema & response things, i divided that way than doing in single patch."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-21 12:31:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck test_create_second_image_when_first_image_is_being_saved cellsv1 race'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-07-21 14:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/580017/6/ : SUCCESS in 2h 06m 57s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-23 00:05:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Merge server create for multiple-create extension

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the server_create for multiple-create extensions.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-rocky

Change-Id: I44f84d7b6b534711e705dd6930df1647a33e324a

commit_message:
Implement delete segment

Added delete segment functionality.
Also added test cases that actually not covering
the line of code but tested the delete segment functionally.

Partial-Implements: blueprint masakari-dashboard

Change-Id: Iabf59e92be9de09d2d2fde48fea403b7cd2bcd26

functionality.Added test cases that actually not covering the

commit_message:
Add log file to tacker-server systemctl daemon script

In devstack tacker script, create /var/log/tacker dir,
then add --log-file parameter to systemctl srcipt.

Closes-bug: #1777622
Change-Id: I6ddec836159ed84d6ffad1a19384cca28c0b7c2d

[{'created': '2018-07-20 07:44:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix DHCP isolated subnets with routed networks

After the merge of [1], the DHCP agent will fail to configure a routed
network when attempting to generate host routes for a non-local subnet
that is also isolated from the point of view of the metadata service.
This patch adds a check to make sure that the host route is not added
for non-local subnets.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468744

Change-Id: Ia03f538a7d2d10d600d9359da5b3a74532709d1f
Closes-Bug: #1758952
(cherry picked from commit bb5138cff4e6c383d4d9e902423072a1493832b9)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix DHCP isolated subnets with routed networks

After the merge of [1], the DHCP agent will fail to configure a routed
network when attempting to generate host routes for a non-local subnet
that is also isolated from the point of view of the metadata service.
This patch adds a check to make sure that the host route is not added
for non-local subnets.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468744

Change-Id: Ia03f538a7d2d10d600d9359da5b3a74532709d1f
Closes-Bug: #1758952
(cherry picked from commit bb5138cff4e6c383d4d9e902423072a1493832b9)

commit_message:
Add cleaning time

This patch adds a margin between the end of a lease and the start of the
next lease. The length of the margin can be configured with the new
configuration option 'cleaning_time'.

Note that it does not actually change start/end_lease time, but just
takes into account the margin when looking for available resources.

Implements: blueprint cleaning-time-allowance
Change-Id: I7de05a65c2221c1eb7c5b2f65bec58d6a48b2085

[{'created': '2017-12-06 09:05:43.000000000', 'message': 'Use proper user and tenant in the owner section of libvirt.xml.

Nova takes instance ownership info from request context when it updates
libvirt.xml, which is not always correct. A real instance owner should
be used to avoid inconsistency in the data stored in the XML file.

Change-Id: Ib1e4803ba4ff17894a0905bcf116225defa5b58a
Closes-Bug: #1607313
(cherry picked from commit 3f2935872da311f79b5fd4d51fb50b4fcf8d2bcd)
'}]
commit_message:
Use proper user and tenant in the owner section of libvirt.xml.

Nova takes instance ownership info from request context when it updates
libvirt.xml, which is not always correct. A real instance owner should
be used to avoid inconsistency in the data stored in the XML file.

Change-Id: Ib1e4803ba4ff17894a0905bcf116225defa5b58a
Closes-Bug: #1607313
(cherry picked from commit 3f2935872da311f79b5fd4d51fb50b4fcf8d2bcd)

commit_message:
Add gabbi tests for invalid date error

The create lease API returned a 500 response status code, but this is
fixed to return a 400 in https://review.openstack.org/583419/.

This patch adds a test for the fix.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/583419/
Change-Id: Id289ae2259a03d49436294cdac1825acbd9005fb

commit_message:
Change invalid date error code to 400

The create lease API and the update lease API returned a 500 response
status code when the date format is invalid. But this should be
400 BadRequest as well as wrong time order (InvalidInput) exception.

This patch changes it to return a 400 response status code.

Change-Id: I7f259d06d8b5e0b901126064a21d313497721e1b

commit_message:
Add test for invalid extra capability key

The length of a host's extra capability key is limited to a maximum
of 64 characters. This error has been changed from 500 Internal Server
Error to 400 Bad Request in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575699/.

This patch adds a test for that change.

Change-Id: I7f88354b917131d5848f3cfd7155ff60c19207a8

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url"

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url".

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: Idaf125a35d36d82b6861930ccb6b9c1dc9231eaf

commit_message:
Fix unit test to properly handle unordered dicts

This patch fixes the unit tests for test_node. we now  properly
compare the dicts used in node.run_workflow so we dont encounter random
failures due to dict order.

Change-Id: Ie7286f89b86ab853c4227e920a37df648b15e96d

commit_message:
Add safe shutdown systemd jobs to tools

Without these jobs, a compute node that is rebooted or powered off may
violently kill off the VMs running inside of it. This has been kept
separate from the main portion of kolla-ansible since no current role
modifies the systemd jobs of the system.

Change-Id: I0a4424f97b5ad872ff0398258c1dc42d31d0ef07

'}, {'created': '2018-01-29 10:36:34.000000000', 'message': 'Log exceptions on security group callbacks

Log exceptions for errors happenning during security groups and rules
callbacks. The callback manager triggering these callbacks wont do
any logging for precommit events. On situations like [1], is was
necessary to enable debug logging to check the reason for error.

The error will still be logged on debug if there is going to be a retry,
and exception logged otherwise. This mimics logging behavior of
mechanism driver calls.

Regarding [1], see change #536935 for a fix that prevents the exception.

[1] http://jira.opendaylight.org/browse/NETVIRT-896

Change-Id: I49872b5b65372ac333ad759bb506fac7348c3fa9

commit_message:
Log exceptions on security group callbacks

This patch adds EXCEPTION-level logging for non-retriable exceptions
during security groups and rules callbacks. The reason is that the
callback manager triggering these callbacks wont do any logging on its
own for precommit events. On situations like [1], it was necessary to
enable debug logging to check the reason behind the error.

Regarding [1], see change [2] for a fix that prevents the exception.

[1] http://jira.opendaylight.org/browse/NETVIRT-896
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536935

Change-Id: I49872b5b65372ac333ad759bb506fac7348c3fa9
co-authored-by: Jaime Caamao Ruiz <jcaamano@suse.com>

commit_message:
Wait for volume available before cleaning up

In compute.v2.test_server.ServerTests.test_server_boot_from_volume,
server is deleted, then delete the volumes attached on server
immediately in clean up logic, but in some slow CI host, the volume is
still in dettaching process, it's not available status, deleting volume
would failed, we need to add some "waiting for" logic in functional
test.

Change-Id: I452862b749e6b855d868adc671e80a065e3be4c2
Closes-Bug: #1698085

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I840925bba72648e1f67aa082cc4423a7f75d65ce

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url"

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url".

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: I63f8e9a00d2b62d1ada53058b79823aa850bbd97

commit_message:
Move requirements deliverable to be independent

While the tracked requirements are cycle based, the
openstack/requirements repo deliverables themselves are not tied to the
cycle. This moves requirements to be an independent deliverable.

Change-Id: I0f55b1f53f9c25b2ce41004d2e0d171c0b8dd90d

subject: Add a ComputePPC64LE role
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-02 03:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-02 03:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-02 03:59:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This needs a follow-on patch in tripleo-docs to explain how to use it.

I'm wondering if it's time to create some form of multi-arch overview document that explians how to use the existing tools to tweak the process for a multi-arch deploy"}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-02-02 07:52:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Having a document that would explain this better would be nice.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:28:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

recheck

I don't think this caused all that red"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-02-28 11:24:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So this looks OK, but I worry it will be too limited, as invariably (sooner or later) we'll need other arch specific configuration or services vs just an override of the image?

The other concern is this leaves us with a potentially mixed group of node types within the e.g "Compute" role, when they are supposed to all be the same within each role.

Typically we've created a new role for each type of Compute, e.g for those that support DPDK, SRIOV, RealTime etc, see:

https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/roles/Compute.yaml

I wonder if we should just accept the duplication (and/or look at some include method to de-duplicate the roles) and add e.g ComputePowerPC to the roles directory above?

Then you'd do this on deploy:

openstack overcloud roles generate -o ~/roles_data.yaml Controller Compute ComputePowerPC

You'd have nodes tagged so that the Flavor deploys ComputePowerPC only on PowerPc nodes, and you can specify a specific image for that role (along with any other special config or services related to that role).

openstack overcloud deploy --templates -r ~/roles_data.yaml

Ref:

https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-docs/latest/install/advanced_deployment/custom_roles.html

I personally think this may be a cleaner and more flexible approach, and it opens up options such as running ad-hoc ansible commands against each group of Compute nodes (lets say there's some task you only need to run on PowerPC, or maybe a security update specific to that arch, you would then have a group already in the tripleo-ansible-inventory with this approach, but not with the Image override).'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-02-28 11:32:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

To clarify, I missed a step where you'd define an environment file with the Flavor/Image for each role, e.g:

cat > compute_env.yaml << EOF
parameter_defaults:
  OvercloudComputeFlavor: compute
  ComputeImage: overcloud-full
  OvercloudComputePowerPCFlavor: compute_powerpc
  ComputePowerPCImage: overcloud-full-powerpc
EOF

And the deploy command would look like:

openstack overcloud deploy --templates -r ~/roles_data.yaml -e compute_env.yaml

etc.

The same approach can also be used for any other role specific parameters with this approach"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-02-28 11:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-02-28 11:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Also related spec https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523459/ where in future we might want to enable splitting the deployment into batches, with the roles approach you could easily deploy e.g a group of powerpc nodes in an independent stack to other roles, which might be preferable in some situations for scale reasons?'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-06-29 04:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-06-29 04:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-06-29 08:13:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-06-29 08:16:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-05 04:34:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

(2 comments)

I'll respin"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-08 04:57:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-07-17 14:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Thanks, looks good - you may also be interested in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583165/ as a future alternative to create multiple duplicate e.g Compute roles where only some params differ'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-17 22:25:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Thanks, looks good - you may also be interested in
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583165/ as a future alternative to
 > create multiple duplicate e.g Compute roles where only some params
 > differ

Awesome!  If I'd had more time I would have liked to do something like that.  I'll keep an eye on it."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-07-22 22:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 03:56:02.000000000', 'message': "Add an ImageMap to allow specific nodes to use a non-default image

As we add multi-arch support it's important to allow nodes flexibility
on what image they need to be deployed with.  This takes the lead from
HostnameMap and create a new json mapping to allow us to select images
per node.  The default is unchnaged.

Change-Id: I9912139048fa11df447c0985e7d53fbcfee7e252
Blueprint: multiarch-support
Co-Authored-By: Steve Baker <sbaker@redhat.com>`
"}, {'created': '2018-02-02 03:57:29.000000000', 'message': "Add an ImageMap to allow specific nodes to use a non-default image

As we add multi-arch support it's important to allow nodes flexibility
on what image they need to be deployed with.  This takes the lead from
HostnameMap and create a new json mapping to allow us to select images
per node.  The default is unchnaged.

Change-Id: I9912139048fa11df447c0985e7d53fbcfee7e252
Blueprint: multiarch-support
Co-Authored-By: Steve Baker <sbaker@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-06-29 04:46:31.000000000', 'message': "Add a ComputePPC64LR role

Create a new role for compute nodes running on ppc64le.  Ideally we
wouldn't need this but at least the overcloud image needs to differ
based on CPU architecture so having a separate role allows us to vary
other parameters.

As the intent is for the same services to run on moth Compute and
ComputePPC64LE add a validation check to ensure that the services stay
in sync.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: I9912139048fa11df447c0985e7d53fbcfee7e252

commit_message:
Add a ComputePPC64LE role

Create a new role for compute nodes running on ppc64le.  Ideally we
wouldn't need this but at least the overcloud image needs to differ
based on CPU architecture so having a separate role allows us to vary
other parameters.

As the intent is for the same services to run on moth Compute and
ComputePPC64LE add a validation check to ensure that the services stay
in sync.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: I9912139048fa11df447c0985e7d53fbcfee7e252

commit_message:
Make pxelinux.cfg folder configurable

Some operators may wish to utilize different default folders
for their bootloaders to search for refernces to the asociated
configuration file.

This patch adds an option to the configuration file that allows
operators to change the default.

Change-Id: I9b8f97868aea74c1b1b458fe8f16ada1ff4ea579

commit_message:
Minor changes for deploy_steps framework

This addresses nits from the two reviews related to the
deploy_steps framework:
- I5feac3856cc4b87a850180b7fd0b3b9805f9225f
- I1baeeaaa6ed521e4189958fd7624cd6c5de96707

It also updates the release note to:
- indicate that support for drivers with no deploy steps will
  be removed in the Stein release (as opposed to the T* release),
  based on discussions in [1].
- mention that node.deploy_step is available in REST API version 1.44.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/ironic/2018/ironic.2018-07-09-15.00.log.html#l-64

Change-Id: I97ab00cab21814287d1b8344b3e4ca0c093fb6ad
Story: #1753128
Task: #22592

commit_message:
Add rpm_install tasks

This patch adds a new rpm_install tasks which can be used
to build a new container layer from a set of local RPMs.
This is useful for building contains locally with no network
connectivity.

As part of the change the existing Yum update Dockerfile.j2 was
renamed to Dockerfile-yum.j2 to make it more specific.

Change-Id: I951c976ebb84c28cecefd2f5753a8232f46ad4aa

commit_message:
Preparing group of host is not a "change"

This task is marked as "changed" while no change is really
happening on the nodes. We should mark this task as "unchanged"
as this is not a trigger of any conditional, and is confusing
in terms of idempotency.

Change-Id: I085050a33e7ce7dba9012f3b7c305c0290197f4b

commit_message:
Don't clean bootstrapped env in ci.centos

When environmnet is set up with get_node script, don't remove
it later.

commit_message:
Add --xattrs to sudoers.

Depending on the environment permissions
the backup creation can fail.

This submission allows using sudo with xattrs
when creating the backup tarball.

(cherry picked from commit 3b3bd2c6dff4dea8d6bfddc745cc532701a2c593)
Change-Id: I1f52b7fbaf6b20a064ab773c6c984db5846e33ec
resolves: rhbz#1594279
Closes-bug:1782341
