commit_message:
add support for keystone federation

This adds the Apache mod_auth_openidc and mod_auth_mellon packages to
the Keystone container to support Keystone federation (as described in
https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/9.3.0/configure_federation.html)

Change-Id: Ia32176eb33737e6f7425bd5e63b4f95eb595cd5f
(cherry picked from commit 52902434cdd2afea73eeb8101f1ca1953058432e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-21 21:22:02.000000000', 'message': "Ignore bashate E044

Bashate introduces a new error, E044, which attempts to
identify any questionable conditionals that would be
incorrectly using bracketing. That being said, it is
modeled on keeping the design simple, and errors on more
condensed lines where conditionals are included.

Since we don't need this, and the case where it is erroring
is invalid as the test is overly simple, lets ignore it.

Change-Id: Ie46dcd6cd6100f3c7e35c2c817828e45bd6b7921
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore bashate E044

Bashate introduces a new error, E044, which attempts to
identify any questionable conditionals that would be
incorrectly using bracketing. That being said, it is
modeled on keeping the design simple, and errors on more
condensed lines where conditionals are included.

Since we don't need this, and the case where it is erroring
is invalid as the test is overly simple, lets ignore it.

Change-Id: Ie46dcd6cd6100f3c7e35c2c817828e45bd6b7921

commit_message:
Drop pyldap from global-requirements.txt

All consuming projects should switch to python-ldap instead,
as pyldap is a deprecated wrapper around it. python-ldap
is maintained and Python 3.x compatible.

Change-Id: Ie998a6eb490abe5c5f937fa008f891221ba1872c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 21:05:53.000000000', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- magnum_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- magnum_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I70c2a340d617bdc603d983fecf4d064975aef780

commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- magnum_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- magnum_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/583430
Change-Id: I70c2a340d617bdc603d983fecf4d064975aef780

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 11:47:42.000000000', 'message': 'process to gracefully exit when last watcher exits

In case all the watchers (in the CNI case the pod watcher only) have
gracefully exited, continuing the process only serves to give a false
appearance of things working. At the same time, it prevents the
containerized deployment orchestrator from realizing that the Kuryr pod
is not functional so it does not restart it.

This fix allows non health proves environments where all watchers have
gracefully exited to be restarted by k8s/ocp and eventually work again
should the issue that made the graceful exits happen be solved.

Change-Id: Id70978e06d980bc0ffa08bcee02d78bef9dcbeb8
Closes-Bug: #1776676
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
(cherry picked from commit 372b835ebb1ebc2592983e3d4cc6dfdc8fa90633)

commit_message:
process to gracefully exit when last watcher exits

In case all the watchers (in the CNI case the pod watcher only) have
gracefully exited, continuing the process only serves to give a false
appearance of things working. At the same time, it prevents the
containerized deployment orchestrator from realizing that the Kuryr pod
is not functional so it does not restart it.

This fix allows non health proves environments where all watchers have
gracefully exited to be restarted by k8s/ocp and eventually work again
should the issue that made the graceful exits happen be solved.

Change-Id: Id70978e06d980bc0ffa08bcee02d78bef9dcbeb8
Closes-Bug: #1776676
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/583922
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
(cherry picked from commit 372b835ebb1ebc2592983e3d4cc6dfdc8fa90633)

commit_message:
OCP-Router: Enable the OCP-Route handler unit tests

Although the file that includes the ocp-route handler unit tests exist,
the unit tests don't run in tox command.
The reason for that was missing __init__.py files.
This patch resolves the __init__.py issue and updates the relevant unit
tests.

Change-Id: I690eadb27095fdd531803804f2517f422e62e3ef
Closes-Bug: 1781825

commit_message:
Clone Kuryr repository by TARGET_BRANCH

The variable $TARGET_BRANCH will be set by devstack. It will point
to the right branch that the devstack is based on. For example,
if the devstack is on a stable branch, TARGET_BRANCH will point to
that stable branch. Using this variable will save us the manual
effort to update the branch whenever we cut a release.

Change-Id: I45f93aa328c4e166d131d18c579651e4e96c3254
(cherry picked from commit a65ae5590cfdfaad57d390ebe7fb477cd2fefa0d)

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-22 16:03:15.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Icb9917ace8028421a617af3e2800a409714fb64a
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Icb9917ace8028421a617af3e2800a409714fb64a

commit_message:
Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: I61a7234dc4fbde1b9319874d82fe33578f490abc
Partial-Bug: 1779534
(cherry picked from commit 184dbb8e18973a8baf69d203c0b159367cb1ff8e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 16:58:18.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure __pycache__ folder is deleted

In some cases like [1] when running python3, the cleanup of
the virtualenv is incomplete: While the *.pyc files are removed,
the python3 __pycache__ folder is not removed.

That causes the sed instruction (applying to files) to fail,
as the __pycache__ folder is not a regular file, but a folder.

With the sed not successfully running, the shebang of the
virtualenv is pointing to an incorrect location, causing then
a failure in keystone-manage commands.

On top of it, a success would happen should the last command
return 0. We now make sure the whole script must return
success.

This should fix the problem.

[1]: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/BWB2q8Y4Gt/

Change-Id: I17ef9325f248319886c7e485ca2f244ffd3307ad
'}, {'created': '2018-07-11 17:02:35.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure __pycache__ folder is deleted

In some cases like [1] when running python3, the cleanup of
the virtualenv is incomplete: While the *.pyc files are removed,
the python3 __pycache__ folder is not removed.

That causes the sed instruction (applying to files) to fail,
as the __pycache__ folder is not a regular file, but a folder.

With the sed not successfully running, the shebang of the
virtualenv is pointing to an incorrect location, causing then
a failure in keystone-manage commands.

On top of it, a success would happen should the last command
return 0. We now make sure the whole script must return
success.

This should fix the problem.

[1]: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/BWB2q8Y4Gt/

Change-Id: I17ef9325f248319886c7e485ca2f244ffd3307ad
'}, {'created': '2018-07-13 08:38:51.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure __pycache__ folder is deleted

In some cases like when running python3, the cleanup of
the virtualenv is incomplete: While the *.pyc files are removed,
the python3 __pycache__ folder is not removed.

That causes the sed instruction (applying to files) to fail,
as the __pycache__ folder is not a regular file, but a folder.

With the sed not successfully running, the shebang of the
virtualenv is pointing to an incorrect location, causing then
a failure in keystone-manage commands.

On top of it, a success would happen should the last command
return 0. We now make sure the whole script must return
success.

This should fix the problem.

Change-Id: I17ef9325f248319886c7e485ca2f244ffd3307ad
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure __pycache__ folder is deleted

In some cases like when running python3, the cleanup of
the virtualenv is incomplete: While the *.pyc files are removed,
the python3 __pycache__ folder is not removed.

That causes the sed instruction (applying to files) to fail,
as the __pycache__ folder is not a regular file, but a folder.

With the sed not successfully running, the shebang of the
virtualenv is pointing to an incorrect location, causing then
a failure in keystone-manage commands.

On top of it, a success would happen should the last command
return 0. We now make sure the whole script must return
success.

This should fix the problem.

Change-Id: I17ef9325f248319886c7e485ca2f244ffd3307ad

commit_message:
Add irrelevant-files to nova-multiattach job in .zuul.yaml

This patch set adds irrelevant-files to nova-multiattach job
in .zuul.yaml because it is the only job without such a stanza
which is important for eliminating unnecessary Zuul resource
consumption, which, for example, is happening here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583451/1

Change-Id: Ib48b735d65d2c005197edef9ab3011f93d0ad28c

commit_message:
add support for keystone federation

This adds the Apache mod_auth_openidc and mod_auth_mellon packages to
the Keystone container to support Keystone federation (as described in
https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/9.3.0/configure_federation.html)

Change-Id: Ia32176eb33737e6f7425bd5e63b4f95eb595cd5f

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/

Change-Id: Ic34952687f54176fccf051ab2e28260e25e107a8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 18:27:07.000000000', 'message': "Add storyboard bug link support to @decorators.related_bug

This patchset does **not** move Tempest to Storyboard; rather,
it allows projects consuming Tempest, including Tempest plugins,
that have moved to Storyboard, the ability to track their bugs
using a relevant Storyboard link.

A new parameter is introduced to related_bug called `bug_page`
which takes in either 'launchpad' (default for backward
compatibility) or 'storyboard'. The appropriate link for each
tracking page is generated based off this value and the 'bug'
value.

This change is useful because Storyboard is the new community
preferred place to track stories and bugs [0]. So Tempest
should add projects the ability to track bugs using it.

Unit tests and releasenotes are included.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/StoryBoard

Change-Id: I97d027458f72a0e736df62acbcbb9b8c007d648c
"}, {'created': '2018-06-29 18:28:23.000000000', 'message': "Add storyboard bug link support to @decorators.related_bug

commit_message:
Add storyboard bug link support to @decorators.related_bug

This patchset does **not** move Tempest to Storyboard; rather,
it allows projects consuming Tempest, including Tempest plugins,
that have moved to Storyboard, the ability to track their bugs
using a relevant Storyboard link.

A new parameter is introduced to related_bug called `bug_page`
which takes in either 'launchpad' (default for backward
compatibility) or 'storyboard'. The appropriate link for each
tracking page is generated based off this value and the 'bug'
value.

This change is useful because Storyboard is the new community
preferred place to track stories and bugs [0]. So Tempest
should provide projects with the ability to track bugs using it.

Unit tests and releasenotes are included.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/StoryBoard

Change-Id: I97d027458f72a0e736df62acbcbb9b8c007d648c

commit_message:
Drop legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ocata from Tempest

This patch set drops legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ocata entry
from Tempest because:

* Tempest already has jobs for tempest-full-queens (n-1) and
  tempest-full-pike (n-2) [0]
* This job is legacy and doesn't use Zuulv3
* This job is voting and makes it harder to merge things Tempest
  side

[0] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/b286ad402e6bd60f33dfd8251d6cf1ed1ceae69d/.zuul.yaml#L162

Change-Id: I9491158fa5decd79a17ef013a138421c9d267021

This fullfills the community goal
"Remove Use of mox/mox3 for Testing" set for Rocky:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/mox_removal.html

Raise the requirement to the Rocky #2 release of horizon,

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Drop mox - no longer needed

The porting of designate-dashboard is complete.
This fullfills the community goal
"Remove Use of mox/mox3 for Testing" set for Rocky:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/mox_removal.html

Raise the requirement to the Rocky #2 release of horizon,
which drops the mox usgae by default (it should be explicitly
enabled) Without a forced import from Horizon the mox dependencies
can be dropped here.
Bump also a dependency needed by this new version of Horizon.

Change-Id: I2ceaf8bae9b20829ec4855cf79635aa805be1984
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary ERROR logging

Some API calls lead to ERROR logging of expected and unexceptional
events (e.g., non-existant resource name/ID supplied by API call.).
These "normal errors" are indicated by API response and do not
belong in the ERROR logging consumed by deployer.

This patch removes the ERROR logging or downgrades to DEBUG logging.

Change-Id: I6e33471e2c28d229dc0f8647a1e59f7fd711df7b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 15:42:44.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic1713fae9a08c5ca234a02a9a403dec611a3cd3b
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic1713fae9a08c5ca234a02a9a403dec611a3cd3b

commit_message:
Port tempest-scenario-all to zuul v3

This patchset ports tempest-scenario-all to zuul v3.

The current job setup is the same as the legacy job setup,
except that the current job setup uses dynamic credentials
whereas the legacy setup used pre-provisioned credentials [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/67081bf4d515fcb5f3294d6ba65ccc5a57c9bc4d/playbooks/tempest-scenario-multinode-lvm-multibackend/run.yaml#L34

Change-Id: Icb2708686cf204a4a4b29ed23e7efa09f14455a5

commit_message:
QNAP: Add support for QES 2.1.0

This patch do the following change to the QNAP Cinder driver:
1. Add support for QNAP QES firmware 2.1.0.

Change-Id: I6693c9b7efb3bc8b361e55ad84183103a5175298
Implements: blueprint qnap-support-qes-210

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 08:37:35.000000000', 'message': 'Non Windows per service lock for Backup service

The introduction of multiple processes on the Backup service in commit
66b1a0049ab78754a5e90c182b09ec501596458c broke the service in Windows.

On commit 1710839a4336dea996910b0894d69d1075c5954c this was fixed by
removing the original usage of os.getpgrp and using a global lock for
all backup services running on the host.

This global lock introduces an unnecessary bottleneck on non Windows
systems.

This patch fixes this bottleneck on non Windows systems by going back to
using a lock using the os.getpgrp method for non Windows systems and
using a global lock for Windows systems.

Related-Bug: #1781168
Change-Id: If7178695bf8ab751bcede14aa56d8becee60e17b
'}]
commit_message:
Non Windows per service lock for Backup service

The introduction of multiple processes on the Backup service in commit
66b1a0049ab78754a5e90c182b09ec501596458c broke the service in Windows.

On commit 1710839a4336dea996910b0894d69d1075c5954c this was fixed by
removing the original usage of os.getpgrp and using a global lock for
all backup services running on the host.

This global lock introduces an unnecessary bottleneck on non Windows
systems.

This patch fixes this bottleneck on non Windows systems by going back to
using a lock using the os.getpgrp method for non Windows systems and
using a global lock for Windows systems.

Related-Bug: #1781168
Change-Id: If7178695bf8ab751bcede14aa56d8becee60e17b

subject: Pin get-pip.py to 3.2
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! messages: [{'account_id': 28427, 'date': '2018-07-18 08:50:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-07-18 10:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-07-19 07:17:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-21 22:36:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 08:50:53.000000000', 'message': "Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I2fa1c67ecd712364a822edcf7470e5489447d990
"}]
commit_message:
Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I2fa1c67ecd712364a822edcf7470e5489447d990

The ingress gate script displayed the `helm status` of the openstack
namespace ingress twice, rather than once for openstack and once
for ceph namespaces.  This fixes.

Change-Id: I9637b44d2cfad45f4935242351ee9160e013364f
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed ingress kube status bug

The ingress gate script displayed the `helm status` of the openstack
namespace ingress twice, rather than once for openstack and once
for ceph namespaces.  This fixes.

Change-Id: I9637b44d2cfad45f4935242351ee9160e013364f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-03 06:13:48.000000000', 'message': "Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Add new 'aio_distro_basekit' jobs to test the minimal basekit deployment
using distribution packages for the OpenStack services.

Change-Id: Ia8c394123b5588fff8c4acbe1532ed5a6dc7e8ec
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567530/
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
"}, {'created': '2018-07-03 21:30:45.000000000', 'message': "Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Add new 'aio_distro_basekit' jobs to test the minimal basekit deployment
using distribution packages for the OpenStack services. Moreover, we
can skip all repo-* related playbooks and roles since we are not
building pip packages for OpenStack services anymore. Finally, we can
populate the utility container using the distribution packages for the
OpenStack client instead of using the wheel packages.

Change-Id: Ia8c394123b5588fff8c4acbe1532ed5a6dc7e8ec
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567530/
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
"}, {'created': '2018-07-04 06:39:15.000000000', 'message': "Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Add new 'aio_distro_basekit' jobs to test the minimal basekit deployment
using distribution packages for the OpenStack services. Moreover, we
can skip all repo-* related playbooks and roles since we are not
building pip packages for OpenStack services anymore. Finally, we can
populate the utility container using the distribution packages for the
OpenStack client instead of using the wheel packages.

Change-Id: Ia8c394123b5588fff8c4acbe1532ed5a6dc7e8ec
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567530/
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
"}, {'created': '2018-07-04 11:11:22.000000000', 'message': "Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Add new 'aio_distro_basekit' jobs to test the minimal basekit deployment
using distribution packages for the OpenStack services. Moreover, we
can skip all repo-* related playbooks and roles since we are not
building pip packages for OpenStack services anymore. Finally, we can

commit_message:
Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Add new 'aio_distro_basekit' jobs to test the minimal basekit deployment
using distribution packages for the OpenStack services.

We can skip all repo-* related playbooks and roles since we are not
building pip packages for OpenStack services anymore. Finally, we can
populate the utility container using the distribution packages for the
OpenStack client instead of using the wheel packages.

Change-Id: Ia8c394123b5588fff8c4acbe1532ed5a6dc7e8ec
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583161/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567530/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580455/
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

[{'created': '2018-07-20 18:30:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add configuration option for specifying MSP IPs

This change adds a configuration option for users to specify
MSP IP addresses to be used for migration. The value should
be specified in configuration as a comma-separated list of
IPs. The MSP IPs on the destination host will be saved in the
migration data where the source host will pass this parameter and
the source MSP IPs to the migration job.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579676/
Change-Id: I091fd6d4246d73602ca19d3e57601018ff6dc925
'}]
commit_message:
Add configuration option for specifying MSP IPs

This change adds a configuration option for users to specify
MSP IP addresses to be used for migration. The value should
be specified in configuration as a comma-separated list of
IPs. The MSP IPs on the destination host will be saved in the
migration data where the source host will pass this parameter and
the source MSP IPs to the migration job.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579676/
Change-Id: I091fd6d4246d73602ca19d3e57601018ff6dc925

[{'created': '2018-06-22 10:32:17.000000000', 'message': 'NEC driver: instance loses access to its volumes after live-migraion.

In Cinder API v3.44 and later, remove_export() is called after live-migration.
In remove_export(), NEC driver detaches the given volume from all servers.
Then the migrated instance on the destination server loses access to its
volumes.
Basically NEC driver detaches volume in terminate_connection().
The detach-from-all is needed only when an attached volume is deleted before
detach.

Closes-Bug: #1777385

This patch moves the detach-from-all from remove_export() to delete_volume().

Change-Id: I7d9398dadca7115ad58040743a55601a592f2fa3

commit_message:
NEC driver: loss of access after live-migration

In Cinder API v3.44 and later, remove_export() is called after
live-migration. In remove_export(), NEC driver detaches the given
volume from all servers. Then the migrated instance on the destination
server loses access to its volumes.
Basically NEC driver detaches volume in terminate_connection().
The detach-from-all is needed only when an attached volume is deleted
before detach.
This patch moves the detach-from-all from remove_export() to
delete_volume().

Closes-Bug: #1777385
Change-Id: I7d9398dadca7115ad58040743a55601a592f2fa3

| 8e4f9395-5c59-498a-af58-95b6ecfac6d2 | ip          | 1.1.1.1   | rw           | active | None       | 2018-07-20T19:45:20.000000 | None       |
| 8ff0a08f-de60-495e-ba19-538fb73a04f1 | ip          | 1.1.1.3   | rw           | active | None       | 2018-07-20T19:58:25.000000 | None       |
+--------------------------------------+-------------+-----------+--------------+--------+------------+----------------------------+------------+
[centos@devstack-host-vm python-manilaclient]$ manila access-show 51362749-7eda-4f65-9e25-0aae72f7bf3f
+--------------+--------------------------------------+
| Property     | Value                                |
+--------------+--------------------------------------+
| access_key   | None                                 |
| share_id     | a5c23b0b-6be7-47f4-9d1b-d9b14cc3565d |
| created_at   | 2018-07-20T19:49:37.000000           |
| updated_at   | None                                 |
| access_type  | ip                                   |
| access_to    | 1.1.1.2                              |
| access_level | rw                                   |
| state        | active                               |
| id           | 51362749-7eda-4f65-9e25-0aae72f7bf3f |
| metadata     | {}                                   |
+--------------+--------------------------------------+

[centos@devstack-host-vm python-manilaclient]$ manila access-list a5c23b0b-6be7-47f4-9d1b-d9b14cc3565d --metadata ''
+----+-------------+-----------+--------------+-------+------------+------------+------------+
| id | access_type | access_to | access_level | state | access_key | created_at | updated_at |
+----+-------------+-----------+--------------+-------+------------+------------+------------+
+----+-------------+-----------+--------------+-------+------------+------------+------------+"}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-07-20 20:30:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> this should work:
>
> $ manila access-list  a5c23b0b-6be7-47f4-9d1b-d9b14cc3565d --metadata junk=junk

Right, my point though is that the usage help puts the metadata args first.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-07-20 20:52:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> Right, my point though is that the usage help puts the metadata args first.


That's a good point, but this isn't new behavior in this patch.. we ought to fix that though"}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-07-20 21:06:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: -Code-Review

> this isn't new behavior in this patch.. we ought to fix that though

OK.

What do you think about not being able to filter on metadata {}.

Should we see the metadata in a plain 'manila access-list <share-id>?

These could be followup issues, I'm just trying to flush them out while we're paying attention."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-07-20 21:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> I don't see a way to search on metadata {}:

Nice! Looks like there's no way to get access rules with no metadata by using the metadata filter like the way you did:

 $ manila --debug access-list test2 --metadata ''

resolves to:

 GET /v2/cadd7139bc3148b8973df097c0911016/share-access-rules?share_id=ee8a6aa7-d685-4905-a9a2-c6c6899fe568&metadata=%7B%27%27%3A+None%7D

The URL params for metadata decoded are:  {'':None}


The problem exists with other commands as well:

 $ manila list --metadata ''
 GET /v2/cadd7139bc3148b8973df097c0911016/shares/detail?metadata=%7B%27%27%3A+None%7D HTTP/1.1

 $ manila --debug type-list --extra-specs ''
 GET /v2/cadd7139bc3148b8973df097c0911016/types?extra_specs=%7B%27%27%3A+None%7D

 $ manila --debug list --extra-specs ''
  GET /v2/cadd7139bc3148b8973df097c0911016/shares/detail?extra_specs=%7B%27%27%3A+None%7D HTTP/1.1

 
The correct URL encoding shouldn't be {"": None}, it should be {} or %7B%7D; but even with that the server seems to misbehave with any of these keys..'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-07-20 21:20:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

OK, the issues I'm finding here aren't specific to access list metadata or introduced by this patch.  We can make bugs for them and move this one along so far as I'm concerned."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-07-20 21:29:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Opened bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-manilaclient/+bug/1782847'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-07-20 22:43:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Tom: This got me thinking about the argparse nargs issue causing the "--metadata" option to be at the end of the command rather than at the front; and it looks like there is a python bug that isn't resolved since 2012: https://bugs.python.org/issue9338 

I see the neutron team has a recommendation, I wonder if we should do this too:

https://docs.openstack.org/python-neutronclient/queens/contributor/cli_option_guideline.html#avoid-using-nargs-in-positional-or-optional-arguments

Looking at the documentation for nargs (https://docs.python.org/3/library/argparse.html#nargs), I don't think we are using it in full conscience. 

I'm leaving my vote on this because I want us to address all the nargs issues at once..'}, {'account_id': 2417, 'date': '2018-07-21 00:36:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-07-21 07:12:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-07-21 11:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-07-21 12:18:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- manilaclient-dsvm-neutron-functional: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1686542

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-07-21 12:40:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-07-21 17:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Support metadata for access rule resource

Now only share have metadata property.
We should support it for access rule as well.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570708/
Change-Id: I41b2882ecd16ed03bece05a7a77a387c9077bf5c
Partly-Implements: bp metadata-for-access-rule

commit_message:
Adding identity ng-groups edit action

This patch adds angular groups edit action.

To be added in subsequent patches:
 - Manage members action

Parent patches:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/480426/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533392/

To Test
 - set 'groups_panel': True in settings.py
 - enable keystone v3 in local_settings.py

Change-Id: I4f02ee4cb95546ec273304326bcbcc603ae373e5
Co-Authored-By: Shu Muto <shu.mutow@gmail.com>

1. Client - frontend data timeout, it's data timeout for:
kuryr-controller <--> K8S API LB listener , right?

When Kuryr-controller communicates to K8S-API (due 2 event received to watcher), it opens a TCP connection, send his requests over it, does it close/terminate the TCP connection, or keep it alive?

Could you please elaborate on the issue we suffered from in tempest tests? 


Since If kuryr controller terminate the connection after"}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-07-16 12:46:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> @Michal, the code looks good, but I'm not sure that I 100%
 > understood the use case, so I have a few questions for you:
 > 
 > 1. Client - frontend data timeout, it's data timeout for:
 > kuryr-controller <--> K8S API LB listener , right?

That's correct.

 > When Kuryr-controller communicates to K8S-API (due 2 event received
 > to watcher), it opens a TCP connection, send his requests over it,
 > does it close/terminate the TCP connection, or keep it alive?

It's kept alive, K8s API implements watching an URL by streaming each event as new chunk of chunked HTTP stream. By default Octavia times out such connection each 50 seconds, so kuryr-controller needs to restart it each time (and possibly crash requests). With this patch connections won't be terminated.

 > Could you please elaborate on the issue we suffered from in tempest
 > tests?
 > 
 > 
 > Since If kuryr controller terminate the connection after"}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-07-16 14:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-07-16 14:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-07-16 15:51:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-07-17 11:38:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-07-17 11:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Octavia (and LBaaS v2) defaults to 50 seconds as data timeout for
connections. This is obviously not acceptable for our Watcher
connections that hang watching on K8s API for a long time.

As Octavia recently made this configurable, this commit extends that
timeout to an hour, easily enough to run of all Tempest tests.

commit_message:
Provide data timeouts for K8s API LB

Octavia (and LBaaS v2) defaults to 50 seconds as data timeout for
connections. This is obviously not acceptable for our Watcher
connections that hang watching on K8s API for a long time.

As Octavia recently made this configurable, this commit extends that
timeout to an hour, easily enough to run of all Tempest tests.

Change-Id: I3fe24355acf0943d78f2d9760877ad594f36715e
Closes-Bug: 1773340

commit_message:
Use K8s API LB IP instead of HOST_IP in DevStack

This commit switches Kuryr configuration to use the IP of load balancer
created for Kubernetes API instead of hardcoding HOST_IP there. This
should be useful e.g. for multinode.

Change-Id: I4535986fdac4d7d6b2eda0debdcaf6122a4f5b9f
Closes-Bug: 1771801

messages:
[{'account_id': 28443, 'date': '2018-06-11 11:45:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-11 11:45:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-06-11 11:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add support for the default_dns_nameservers variable

This variable was introduced in Newton and allows you to specify a
list of default DNS servers populated when creating a tenant subnet.

Change-Id: I7c6767bb883296c55b7a7302d7af8a8721fd2844

commit_message:
Correctly pull input data for enforcement

Pull the actual input data into the enforcement target dict instead
of the view_args (the view args are something like 'trust_id', the
input data would be user-supplied json).

Change-Id: I9d7b1117d4decfd31647d6418f02302917ca1cbd
Partial-Bug: #1776504

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 21:36:19.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Check filter validation extension

Change-Id: I057cd917628c77dd20c0ff7747936c3fec7b4844
'}, {'created': '2018-06-18 17:46:15.000000000', 'message': 'Check filter validation extension

Passing a unknown filter might raise if the filter validation
feature is enabled at server side. This patch checks the present
of filter-validation extension and perfrom different assertions
accordingly.

Related-Bug: #1749820
Change-Id: I057cd917628c77dd20c0ff7747936c3fec7b4844
'}, {'created': '2018-06-18 22:17:46.000000000', 'message': 'Assert BadRequest on unknown filter

Passing a unknown filter might raise if the filter validation
feature is enabled at server side. This patch checks the present
of filter-validation extension and assert neutron returns
BadRequest on unknown filter.

Related-Bug: #1749820
Change-Id: I057cd917628c77dd20c0ff7747936c3fec7b4844
'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 18:55:14.000000000', 'message': "Skip filter validation tests

There is an on-going effort on adding support for strict filter
validation [1]. During the transition period when neutron is
migrating to strict filter validation, the filter validation
tests might fail. According to the tempest's suggestion [2],
this patch temporarily skips those tests, which is necessary to
make the CI happy to land the server side patches.
These tests will be modified and re-enabled after the implemention
is finished in server side.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574907/
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/HACKING.html
    #bug-fix-on-core-project-needing-tempest-changes

Related-Bug: #1749820
Change-Id: I057cd917628c77dd20c0ff7747936c3fec7b4844
"}]
commit_message:
Skip filter validation tests

There is an on-going effort on adding support for strict filter
validation [1]. During the transition period when neutron is
migrating to strict filter validation, the filter validation
tests might fail. According to the tempest's suggestion [2],
this patch temporarily skips those tests, which is necessary to
make the CI happy to land the server side patches.
These tests will be modified and re-enabled after the implemention
is finished in server side.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574907/
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/HACKING.html
    #bug-fix-on-core-project-needing-tempest-changes

Related-Bug: #1749820
Change-Id: I057cd917628c77dd20c0ff7747936c3fec7b4844

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Change-Id: Ieef90c80f4a808ff5f308cf5693b7b9bf6377e79
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 21:11:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add osprofiler to api-paste pipeline

The osprofiler filter is included in the standard pipelines for
nova, glance, cinder, heat, magnum [1], but is missing for
upstream neutron.

This means when a deployment uses profiling, there is a gap in the
data collected when the neutron API is executing.

Upstream fix https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583362/

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/blob/master/templates/api-paste.ini.j2#L31-L32

Change-Id: I63e2e8a1886527d363986bbb82c069eaaaa4406a
Partial-Bug: #1781619
'}]
commit_message:
Add osprofiler to api-paste pipeline

The osprofiler filter is included in the standard pipelines for
nova, glance, cinder, heat, magnum [1], but is missing for
upstream neutron.

This means when a deployment uses profiling, there is a gap in the
data collected when the neutron API is executing.

Upstream fix https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583362/

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/blob/master/templates/api-paste.ini.j2#L31-L32

Change-Id: I63e2e8a1886527d363986bbb82c069eaaaa4406a
Partial-Bug: #1781619

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 06:14:13.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I89f14811602901e8165ca0f6bbf535dbdbb0a528
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I89f14811602901e8165ca0f6bbf535dbdbb0a528

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I9d458b424e13bbbed4d6490da953cd6f07d5107b

commit_message:
Update comment in blacklist for networking repos

As https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553240/ has shown, adding
upper-constraints for these repos does not work, we can only use the
versions from the previous release and those versions conflict with
other packages from current release. Therefore leave them - unlike
previously planned - in blacklist.txt and update the comment to reflect
this.

Change-Id: I3bbf28720b8ae7752df0ae56de2d42451cf52296

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I0918cfba9b86ad0c6bea79db68b1b31f89a9cb6a

commit_message:
Switch to not-voting check-requirements for git-upstream

Git-upstream doesn't fully comply with check-requirements and will
require a number of iterations to land before it can be re-enabled.

Change from the check-requirements template to run the job from
openstack/requirements 'requirements-check' non-voting.

Note git-upstream is not listed in openstack/requirements projects.txt.

Change-Id: Id62d4afdcd78361550c9f36ace4115599b4dec69

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I19371774a77465aa74d4b1d29b002b33ee4a05c4

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If39edb4fc412b42fe9b99d4ca803c71df4cc55cd

Currently, a non privileged tenant can add a router interface to a
shared / external network's subnet with an IP address outside the
subnet's allocation pool, creating a security risk. This patch prevents
tenants who are not the subnet's owner or admin from assigning a router
interface an IP address outside the subnet's allocation pool.

Change-Id: I32e76a83443dd8e7d79b396499747f29b4762e92

(cherry picked from commit 54aa6e81cb17b33ce4d5d469cc11dec2869c762d)

commit_message:
Disallow router interface out of subnet IP range

Currently, a non privileged tenant can add a router interface to a
shared / external network's subnet with an IP address outside the
subnet's allocation pool, creating a security risk. This patch prevents
tenants who are not the subnet's owner or admin from assigning a router
interface an IP address outside the subnet's allocation pool.

Change-Id: I32e76a83443dd8e7d79b396499747f29b4762e92
Closes-Bug: #1757482
(cherry picked from commit 54aa6e81cb17b33ce4d5d469cc11dec2869c762d)

You can't ATM test a kolla patch in TripleO CI by adding a Depends-On since images are not rebuilt for each job.

commit_message:
Added tempest user for tempest container

* Currently on using tempest container, everything is running as a
  root user under the container. All the test data when copied from
  container to host, have different permission. In order to consume
  those data we need to change permission. Adding tempest user to
  tempest container fix the issue.

* New user can pass --user 'tempest' with docker run to consume it.

* It does not affect the workflow of tempest container used in tripleo ci.
Change-Id: I719b7b13197bcb1ace607f10448d76ccb1d8cdf7

messages: [{'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-07-20 01:52:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-20 01:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-20 02:03:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-21 00:22:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 01:52:44.000000000', 'message': 'Default --deployment-user to $SUDO_USER

We know this is running under sudo, since we explicitly run it as such.
$SUDO_USER is a better default for --deployment-user in that case
instead of just assuming stack. When $SUDO_USER is unset, it still falls
back to stack.

Change-Id: I4234274f41e9e565893b212238d4ab65a075c5e3
'}]
commit_message:
Default --deployment-user to $SUDO_USER

We know this is running under sudo, since we explicitly run it as such.
$SUDO_USER is a better default for --deployment-user in that case
instead of just assuming stack. When $SUDO_USER is unset, it still falls
back to stack.

Change-Id: I4234274f41e9e565893b212238d4ab65a075c5e3

we use 'fixed_ips' parameter instead.

Change-Id: I1189bc9a50308df5c7e18c329f3a1262c90b9e12

server ignored this parameter, and returned all the
ports, which happened to make the test pass.

This patch fixes the usage of this parameter. If there is no ip_address
then not to filter the list using the filter. Otherwise,
we use 'fixed_ips' parameter and populate its value correctly.

Change-Id: I1189bc9a50308df5c7e18c329f3a1262c90b9e12

commit_message:
Correct the usage on listing neutron ports

The test case uses 'fixed_ip' as a query parameter, but the usage
is not correct. In before, the test passed because neutron
server ignored this parameter, and returned all the
ports, which happened to make the test pass.

This patch fixes the usage of this parameter. If there is no ip_address
then not to filter the list using the filter. Otherwise,
we use 'fixed_ips' parameter and populate its value correctly.

Change-Id: I1189bc9a50308df5c7e18c329f3a1262c90b9e12

[{'created': '2018-07-19 12:22:18.000000000', 'message': 'Remove role_data from inventory

role_data is extremely verbose and not actually needed since
Idfdce6f0a778b0a7f2fed17ff56d1a3e451868ab landed. Removing it from the
inventory will improve readability.

Removing it also avoids issues with hostvars since the role_data_* keys
are set as host variables and are not properly escaped when the task
lists include jinja themselves.

Change-Id: I06c9b3256567cc57d599bd4d9af617c718d2314f
(cherry picked from commit f6349940e8bd8f0d44a67e0e1db8f577b69e751c)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove role_data from inventory

role_data is extremely verbose and not actually needed since
Idfdce6f0a778b0a7f2fed17ff56d1a3e451868ab landed. Removing it from the
inventory will improve readability.

Removing it also avoids issues with hostvars since the role_data_* keys
are set as host variables and are not properly escaped when the task
lists include jinja themselves.

Change-Id: I06c9b3256567cc57d599bd4d9af617c718d2314f
(cherry picked from commit f6349940e8bd8f0d44a67e0e1db8f577b69e751c)

commit_message:
Updates OpenDaylight HA Proxy backend check

The new URI is more accurate and only supported as of ODL version
Fluorine. It will also return an HTTP error code when the ODL is
isolated from the cluster so that HA Proxy will not send it requests.

Closes-Bug: 1715387

Change-Id: Ib841b2fc68e5b1f6480298afce20b91a7afef634
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit cf4ef5f884eeaabf36eaa1afaecfaae034a06a7c)

commit_message:
Support metadata for access rule resource

Now only share have metadata property.
We should support it for access rule as well.

DocImpact

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579534
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571366

Implements: bp metadata-for-access-rule

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 16:23:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix tempest-deployer-input.conf path

Tempest containerized run as root, and so, although the
tempest-deployer-input.conf file was being imported to the container,
the patch was ~/tempest-deployer-input.conf that was pointing to /root
instead of working_dir, so, tempestconf wasn't getting the defaults from
the deployer input file, setting the region to RegionOne instead of
regionOne, and so, the object_store tests were failing, because was
getting the default endpoint http://.../ instead of http://.../v1/AUTH

Change-Id: Ic88c9121441b4021da3400933cacc4ff942b727f
Closes-Bug: 1773325
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tempest-deployer-input.conf path

Tempest containerized run as root, and so, although the
tempest-deployer-input.conf file was being imported to the container,
the patch was ~/tempest-deployer-input.conf that was pointing to /root
instead of working_dir, so, tempestconf wasn't getting the defaults from
the deployer input file, setting the region to RegionOne instead of
regionOne, and so, the object_store tests were failing, because was
getting the default endpoint http://.../ instead of http://.../v1/AUTH

Change-Id: Ic88c9121441b4021da3400933cacc4ff942b727f
Closes-Bug: 1773325

commit_message:
Add support for microversion 2.65

There are no functional changes for this, just bumping
the supported client-side version and updating docs.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/573136/

Part of blueprint abort-live-migration-in-queued-status

Change-Id: Ie0777dbe4d82892ec75b353f6b13ee2d2c5db72c

commit_message:
Lower Ceph PGs count in scenario004

Each OSD can only host maximum 200 PGs, in scenario004 we create 9
pools to enable MDS/Manila and RGW so we need to lower the PGs
count further, compared to scenario001.

Also lowers the values in low-memory-usage.yaml environment file.

Change-Id: If95a0e3fe5aeef61f9712d8006e0f49c11a0c90f
Closes-Bug: 1781910
(cherry picked from commit d348ebc34ee223b301f639be37255056f8f34c9c)

commit_message:
use restore_file instead of open volume when restoring

when do _check_restore_vol_size in ceph, cinder-backup
cannot open restored volume image

Change-Id: I3e093665d37952ab656c205400b227cc073ca472
Closes-bug:#1777588

Remove note about mox

Remove the note about using mox in unit tests since
mox has been removed in cinder.

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add secondary DNS server to disable-unbound environment

The Cloudflare DNS we are using in the disable-unbound CI
environment for OpenShift works fine in CI, but my ISP seems to
block it. This makes reproducing that job locally difficult. I had
success with the secondary DNS from Cloudflare, so this patch just
adds that to the resolv.conf.

If we were going to keep this disable-unbound solution for a long
time it would probably be better to have this be a template and
allow user configuration. However, my understanding is that this
is a temporary solution, so investing in complicated patches to
wire in a configuration option that will go away seems like
wasted effort.

Change-Id: I7b93efcd76b651807dff3c18885b8d291feffd3e

[{'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-07-20 09:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-07-20 09:15:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-20 10:47:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-20 10:56:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

also I'm not sure we need the revert *now*. The gate doesn't look that bad, and we don't have that many hits. What do you mean by CI blocker? Do you have numbers? Links?
Yes it's failing, but I would rather increase the timeout than reverting this code that we're trying to land for a while now. Containers were unhealthy for a while and it wasn't acceptable, I think reverting this one would be a step backward."}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-07-20 13:10:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I'd question the current logic. It takes at lest 120s for container to be marked unhealthy (with the default interval=30, retries=3) but the defaults can be overridden in paunch.

Also during container init (and I expect under high load) we appear to miss a few healthcheck (they are delayed at least). I think we should just ignore failure for the first few minutes - newer docker versions have a startup-period option for this.

So I think we either have to accept a few minutes delay at the end of each step or we perform a single check at the end of the final step."}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-07-20 13:12:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

TL;DR this needs further thought IMO, so I would revert for now.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-20 14:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-07-20 14:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:06:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Revert "Check container health as part of the deploy"

There is a CI blocker LP 1782598 to deal with ASAP.
Then, we can fix this in the scope of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584119/

This reverts commit 915c1ebdd79fecb57a0719997a56c34685307431.

Change-Id: I8f03d8a588e58202c3628c72144a232729041c89
